name: Jon Koval
description: Koval is a vice president at Antonio Gracias' Valor Equity Partners and works with Gracias at SSA. He is also active at Veterans Affairs alongside fellow Valor employee Payton Rehling and other DOGE staffers.

name: Justin Monroe
description: Monroe worked in information security at SpaceX and previously served in the US Navy as an information warfare officer. He is listed as an 'expert' at OPM and is working as an adviser within the office of the FBI's director.

profilePicture: ./Meet Elon Musk's DOGE Recruits, Allies in Trump's Government_files/-1x-1(2).jpg
name: Jared Isaacman
description: The founder of payments processing company Shift4, Isaacman has twice traveled to space on SpaceX rockets. Shift4 has invested $27.5 million in SpaceX and provides services for Starlink, Musk's satellite internet service.

name: Payton Rehling
description: A senior associate and data engineer at Valor Equity Partners, Rehling works with Gracias at SSA and was named a DOGE representative with data access at USCIS. He also supports Veterans Affairs alongside other DOGE staffers.

name: Riccardo Biasini
description: An automotive engineer whose description is partly truncated in the source.

name: Adam Ramada
description: An investor from Miami with a history of backing Musk's companies. As an analyst, he pushed Islet Capital to support Tesla and now audits contract and grant programs at the Education Department while improving IT systems at the Labor Department.

name: Alexander Simonpour
description: Former Tesla engineer now on the DOGE team at NASA, where he is reportedly helping to oversee the agency's reduction in force.

name: Jehn Balajadia
description: A longtime assistant to Musk, Balajadia has worked as an operations coordinator at the Boring Co. and informally for the Musk Foundation. She helped orchestrate a $10 million gift to the University of Texas at Austin for research into population decline and now works with DOGE.

profilePicture: ./Meet Elon Musk's DOGE Recruits, Allies in Trump's Government_files/-1x-1(5).jpg
name: Steve Davis
description: An aerospace engineer with over 20 years of experience assisting Musk in cost-cutting at SpaceX, the Boring Co., and Twitter. Davis is widely seen as Musk's right hand at DOGE and was identified as the team's chief operating officer in a Fox News interview.

profilePicture: ./Meet Elon Musk's DOGE Recruits, Allies in Trump's Government_files/-1x-1(3).jpg
name: Joe Gebbia
description: The source does not provide a detailed description for Joe Gebbia.

name: Thomas Shedd
description: Former software integration engineering manager at Tesla for nearly eight years, now serving as director of Technology Transformation Services at GSA and as chief information officer at the Labor Department.

name: Anthony Armstrong
description: Twitter Banker A former Morgan Stanley technology banker who worked on Musk's Twitter acquisition, Armstrong now advises OPM on reducing the government workforce.

profilePicture: ./Meet Elon Musk's DOGE Recruits, Allies in Trump's Government_files/-1x-1(4).jpg
name: Michael Grimes
description: Twitter Banker With a 30‚Äêyear career as a technology investment banker, Grimes advised Musk on his $44 billion Twitter acquisition and is now a senior official in the Department of Commerce, tapped to lead a planned sovereign wealth fund.

name: Marko Elez
governmentRole_3: Department of Health and Human Services
description: A 2021 Rutgers University graduate who worked at Musk-run companies including SpaceX, X, and xAI. He joined DOGE in the Treasury Department but later resigned after controversial social media posts.

profilePicture: ./Meet Elon Musk's DOGE Recruits, Allies in Trump's Government_files/-1x-1(1).jpg
name: Antonio Gracias
description: The founder, chief investment officer, and CEO of Valor Equity Partners, Gracias is a longtime investor in Musk's companies.
